data.text:
PLA Media is excited to announce the newest addition to our client roster, Grammy nominated and BMI “Million-Air” award winning singer/songwriter Pam Rose. Rose is preparing the release of her next project Sacred Song and is currently featured in the documentary Invisible premiering at the Nashville Film Festival on Tuesday, October 5 at 7 PM CT at Marathon Music Works.

Pam Lewis, PLA Media founder, proclaims, “I first discovered Pam’s enthralling songwriting prowess when I moved to Nashville to work for RCA. She was a pioneer working head-to-head with ‘the boys who make the noise on the 16th Avenue’ carving her own niche and earning both respect and formidable success. PLA is honored to have her on our roster!”

“I’ll never forget where I was when my lifetime writing and duo partner Mary Ann Kennedy played a me cassette tape of an unknown artist from Oklahoma that Pam Lewis was considering managing,” recalls Pam Rose. “Pam did say ‘yes’ and that artist was none other than Garth Brooks. Ever since then, I have known her instincts to be impeccable. I’m so pleased to be working with Pam, Mark and PLA to escort my newest project into the world. I really look forward to this exciting collaboration and a successful launch to Sacred Song.”

Prior to the launch of her solo career, the Chattanooga native first gained notoriety in the internationally acclaimed duo, Kennedy Rose, with singer/songwriter Mary Ann Kennedy. Their avant-garde sound won the ear of international megastar, Sting which led to a two-album recording contract with his label, Pangaea Records. Rose has always excelled as a collaborator and has performed alongside prolific industry icons including, Art Garfunkel, Neil Young, Emmylou Harris, and more, with appearances on the hit records, “How Do I Live” by Leann Rimes and “Independence Day” with Martina McBride. With two Grammy nominations already underneath her belt, the multi-talented virtuoso is currently preparing to release her third solo studio album, Sacred Song. The album will highlight Pam’s lyrical ingenuity, poise, and mature tenor.

About Pam Rose

Pam Rose was born in Chattanooga, Tennessee. In her adolescence, she relocated to Atlanta, then to the East Coast of Florida, where she spent her formative years. Rose would enroll at Florida State University and earned a bachelor’s degree in Music. She eventually returned to Atlanta to receive instruction under her mentor and long-time friend, jazz musician Paul Mitchell.

With the launch of the harmonic duo Kennedy Rose with Mary Ann Kennedy, Rose propelled throughout the industry to achieve two Grammy nominations for Song of the Year – “I’ll Still Be Loving You” and once again for “Ring On Her Finger, Time On Her Hands.” The duo also won over the ears of international megastar Sting, who praised them for their “uncategorizable music.” While signed to his private label Pangaea Records, they completed two studio albums.

As a writer, her songs have been cut by Reba McEntire, Martina McBride, Crystal Gayle, Patty Loveless, Lee Greenwood, Restless Heart, Carlene Carter and more. Hits like the aforementioned pair that secured the Grammy nominations alongside staples like “Safe In the Arms of Love” and “You Will” would rack up six BMI “Million-Air” Awards. Rose also achieved the BMI Pop Award for two consecutive years for Restless Heart’s “I’ll Still Be Loving You.” Among her collection of most prominent live performances are President Bill Clinton’s presidential inauguration ceremony and “Interdependence Day Think Tank & Peace Conferences” in the US, Mexico, Turkey and Germany.

Pam has previously released two self-penned albums alongside the two releases as Kennedy Rose. On the small screen this out LGBTQ performer has been featured on PBS TV shows “Tommy Emmanuel & Friends” and “Austin City Limits” and NBC’s “Dolly Parton 50th Anniversary.” Presently, Pam is preparing the release of her newest album, Sacred Song and can be seen sharing her own story in the documentary Invisible currently on the festival circuit.
